video.title: The Blue Planet: A Natural History of the Oceans
video.synopsis: David Attenborough narrates this definitive exploration of the marine world, from the familiar to the unknown, revealing the sea and its communities.

seasons.title: A Natural History of the Oceans

episodes.synopsis: Follow the largest animal on earth: the blue whale. Then discover creatures on the ocean's floor, and witness the aquatic food chain in action.
episodes.title: Ocean World

episodes.synopsis: In the pitch-black abyss of the depths of the seas lie alien-like creatures and other strange species just waiting to be discovered.
episodes.title: The Deep

episodes.synopsis: The predator-prey struggle is played out in the ocean, where it's a dolphin-eat-fish world. Witness the feeding habits of dolphins, whales and more.
episodes.title: Open Ocean

episodes.synopsis: Most animals retreat to warmer temperatures when winter sets in, but some creatures choose to stick out the frigid weather and fight for survival.
episodes.title: Frozen Seas

episodes.synopsis: Witness the shifting habits of sea creatures as they adjust to changing water temperatures with the turn of the seasons.
episodes.title: Seasonal Seas

episodes.synopsis: Surprisingly fragile coral reefs are susceptible to damage by sea life, natural phenomena and humans. Follow coral's development from birth to death.
episodes.title: Coral Seas

episodes.synopsis: Sea creatures have timed their comings and goings to the tides. See how land and sea animals take advantage of the changing levels of water.
episodes.title: Tidal Seas

episodes.synopsis: Several sea animals make long treks to coasts around the world to feed, breed or lay eggs. What are the reasons behind these peculiar migrations?
episodes.title: Coasts
